citeinfo.origin: Ocean Engineering Research Group, Center for Coastal Studies, Scripps Institute for Oceanography
citeinfo.title: Coastal Data Information Program (CDIP) Data

abstract.p: Real-time and historical wave data dating back as far as 1975 for the coasts of California, Oregon, Washington, Hawaii, Georgia, Minnesota, Virginia, and North Carolina. The wave data, and in some cases wind, temperature and current data are collected within 30 miles of the shore. As such, CDIP data complement National Buoy Data Center (NDBC) data, generally collected 100 to 300 miles off-shore. CDIP has plans to standardize some NDBC data for use with CDIP data. CDIP also plans to make all CDIP data available since 1975 accessible on the web.

descript.purpose: To measure, analyze, archive and disseminate coastal environment data for use by coastal engineers, planners, and managers, as well as scientists and mariners.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
